events.originalText: Around 250,000 farmed non-native Atlantic salmon were accidentally released into the wild near Cypress Island, Washington.
events.subtitle: Fish farming
events.headline: 250,000 Atlantic Salmon Accidentally Released Near Cypress Island, Washington

events.originalText: Thunderstorms in southern Ontario, Canada, spawned at least three tornadoes that caused over C$500 million in damage.
events.subtitle: Ontario
events.headline: Southern Ontario Thunderstorms Spawn Three Tornadoes Causing Over C$500 Million in Damage

events.originalText: A Hamas suicide bomber killed 23 people and wounded more than 130 others, including many Orthodox Jewish children, on a crowded public bus in Shmuel HaNavi, Jerusalem.
events.subtitle: Hamas
events.headline: Hamas Suicide Bomber Kills 23 in Jerusalem, Including Orthodox Jewish Children

events.originalText: Second Chechen War: A Russian Mil Mi-26 was brought down by Chechen separatists with a man-portable air-defense system near Khankala, killing 127 people in the deadliest helicopter crash in history.
events.subtitle: Second Chechen War
events.headline: Deadliest Helicopter Crash in History Near Khankala Kills 127 in Second Chechen War

events.originalText: The intelligence agencies of the United Kingdom and the United States orchestrated a coup d'état of Iranian prime minister Mohammad Mosaddegh and restored the constitutional monarchy of Mohammad Reza Pahlavi.
events.subtitle: Intelligence agency
events.headline: UK and US Intelligence Agencies Orchestrate Coup in Iran

events.originalText: The 766th Independent Infantry Regiment of North Korea was disbanded after fighting for less than two months in the Korean War.
events.subtitle: 766th Independent Infantry Regiment (North Korea)
events.headline: North Korean Infantry Regiment Disbanded After Two Months in Korean War

events.originalText: A referendum supported the recent merging of the posts of Chancellor and President of Germany, consolidating Adolf Hitler's assumption of supreme power.
events.subtitle: 1934 German referendum
events.headline: Referendum Supports Merging of Chancellor and President Posts in Germany

events.originalText: Russian Civil War: Peasants in Tambov Governorate began a rebellion against the Bolshevik government of Soviet Russia.
events.subtitle: Russian Civil War
events.headline: Peasant Rebellion Against Bolshevik Government Begins in Tambov Governorate

events.originalText: The Bersey Electric Cab  entered service as the first electric taxi in London.
events.subtitle: Bersey Electric Cab
events.headline: First Electric Taxi Enters Service in London as Bersey Electric Cab

events.originalText: Seven Years' War: Having damaged several French vessels, British ships pursued the remainder of the fleet to Lagos, Portugal, and continued the battle there (depicted) in violation of Portuguese neutrality.
events.subtitle: Seven Years' War
events.headline: British Ships Pursue French Fleet to Lagos, Portugal in Violation of Neutrality

events.originalText: Bonnie Prince Charlie (pictured) raised the Jacobite standard at Glenfinnan, Scotland, in an attempt to regain the British throne for his father, beginning the Jacobite rising of 1745.
events.subtitle: Charles Edward Stuart
events.headline: Bonnie Prince Charlie Raises Jacobite Standard in Glenfinnan, Scotland

events.originalText: Shortly after his return from the Ninth Crusade, Edward I was crowned King of England at Westminster Abbey, nearly two years after his father's death.
events.subtitle: Lord Edward's crusade
events.headline: Edward I Crowned King of England After Ninth Crusade Return
